summary.para: The CMSG_CTRL_KEY_AGREE_DECRYPT_PARA structure contains information about a key agreement recipient.
The size, in bytes, of this data structure.

A handle to the cryptographic service provider (CSP) used to do the recipient key encryption and export. If NULL, the provider specified in is used. The CNG function is called to determine the union choice.

A handle to the CNG CSP used to do the recipient key encryption and export. The CNG function is called to determine the union choice. New encrypt algorithms are only supported in CNG functions. The CNG function will be called to convert the CryptoAPI CSP hCryptProv choice where necessary. We recommend that applications pass, to the hNCryptKey member, the CNG CSP handle that is returned from the function.
Specifies the encrypted key. The encrypted key is the result of encrypting the content-encryption key. This member is not used when the hNCryptKey member is used.
Indicates a specific recipient in an array of recipients.
Indicates a specific encrypted key in an array of encrypted keys.
A structure that contains the sender's public key information.
